heaviest_rainfall.status: Record-breaking rain fell on 04 January 2025 with a total accumulation of 36.8mm over 37.2 hours and falling at a rate of 4.6mm per hour at times.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A torrential downpour occurred on 02 September 2025 when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 27.0mm per hour.  This happened during a 15.0 hour storm when 21.19mm of rain fell.

longest_rain.status: On 04 January 2025, the rain lasted for 37.2 hours, which is the longest time recorded by our database.  36.8mm accumulated and it fell at 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The lightning strike count peaked at 23 on 07 September 2025, the highest since recording started on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: Stormy conditions are expected.  This is the first storm in the region since 22 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The ongoing rainy stretch, 6 days and counting started on 18 October 2025 and ranks 10th in length since records started in 23 September 2024.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no cold snap in progress.  So far, 6 cold snaps have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 3.7.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no heatwaves in progress.  So far, 6 heatwavess have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is south-westerly (207°).  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: The top recorded wind gust is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: 1737 miles is the largest wind run recorded on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 2.6°C) and outside temperature (down 1.6°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.1 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in rainfall (up 0.1 mm) and cloud levels (up 106 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (up 0.1 mm) and cloud levels (up 390 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 106.1m lower than yesterday, 79.6m lower than the past week, 390.4m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 706m and a peak of 2390m, averaging 1048.8m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.
cloud levels.summary: Partial cloudiness with some periods of sun.

The dew point temperatures yesterday fell between 5.2°C minimum and 10.7°C maximum, with an average of 6.8°C; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 9.9°C and 8.8°C.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; cold spells are likely. Also, dry air conditions likely prevail and near calm conditions. Chance of light rain, partial cloudiness with some periods of sun, and a mix of sun and clouds. Weather could become unsettled.

washing.phrase: The current temperature is too low (5.3°C) for optimal drying conditions.  Any drying will take longer.
